How Our RAM Evaluation Works

Transparent, professional assessment process that ensures you get fair market value for your computer memory.

üé≠ Parody of automotive evaluation sites - but our RAM buying is 100% real!

Simple 4-Step Process

1

Submit Specifications

Enter your RAM details including type (DDR3/DDR4/DDR5), capacity, speed, brand, and condition. Our form guides you through identifying the correct specifications.

2

Instant Evaluation

Our pricing algorithm analyzes current market conditions, brand reputation, and condition factors to provide an immediate quote range for your memory modules.

3

Professional Review

Our hardware specialists review your submission and contact you within 24 hours with a final offer and shipping instructions for your RAM modules.

4

Get Paid

Once we receive and verify your RAM, payment is processed within 2 business days via your preferred method (PayPal, bank transfer, or check).

RAM Evaluation Criteria

üîß

Technical Specifications

  • Memory Type: DDR3, DDR4, DDR5 compatibility and generation
  • Capacity: Module size from 1GB to 128GB per stick
  • Speed Rating: Frequency in MHz (e.g., 2400MHz, 3200MHz)
  • Form Factor: DIMM, SO-DIMM, or specialized formats
  • Timing: CAS latency and other timing specifications
üè≠

Brand & Quality

  • Premium Brands: Corsair, G.Skill, Kingston HyperX
  • Mainstream: Crucial, Samsung, SK Hynix
  • Budget Tier: Generic and OEM modules
  • Server Grade: ECC and registered memory
  • Warranty Status: Remaining warranty coverage
‚≠ê

Physical Condition

  • New: Unopened packaging, full warranty (100% value)
  • Excellent: Light use, no visible wear (85-95% value)
  • Good: Normal use, minor cosmetic wear (70-85% value)
  • Fair: Heavy use, visible wear but functional (50-70% value)
  • Poor: Damaged or non-functional (case-by-case basis)
üìà

Market Factors

  • Current Demand: Popular configurations get premium pricing
  • Age Factor: Newer generations typically worth more
  • Availability: Rare or discontinued modules may have higher value
  • Bulk Pricing: Multiple identical modules receive bonus
  • Seasonal Trends: Market fluctuations affect pricing

What RAM We Accept

‚úÖ We Accept

  • DDR3, DDR4, and DDR5 desktop memory
  • Laptop SO-DIMM modules
  • Server ECC and registered memory
  • Gaming and overclocking RAM
  • Bulk quantities and matched sets
  • Both used and new modules
  • All major brands and speeds

‚ùå We Don't Accept

  • DDR2 or older memory types
  • Physically damaged modules
  • Memory that fails testing
  • Modules with bent or broken pins
  • Counterfeit or remarked chips
  • Memory with removed heat spreaders
  • Modules missing identification labels
